title: Miravi - a linked data viewer
introductionText: Please log in as the appropriate actor and make your choice in the menu on the left.

queries.name: My idols
queries.description: Demonstrates a simple query, using a proxy.

queries.name: Some images
queries.description: Demonstrates how to show images in a query result.

queries.name: Is there an artist influenced by Picasso?
queries.description: Demonstrates an ASK query.

askQuery.trueText: Yes, there is at least one artist influenced by Picasso!
askQuery.falseText: No, there is not a single artist influenced by Picasso.

queries.name: A graph of artists influenced by Picasso
queries.description: Demonstrates a CONSTRUCT query.

queries.name: Average value
queries.description: Demonstrates a query calculating some average.

queries.name: A secret list of my favorite books
queries.description: Demonstrates a query whose source requires authentication.

queries.name: A public list of books I'd love to own
queries.description: Demonstrates a query whose source does not require authentication.

queries.name: A query about musicians
queries.description: Demonstrates what happens if one of the sources is not available (fetch failure).

queries.name: A templated query about musicians
queries.description: Demonstrates the usage of templated queries.

queries.name: A templated query about musicians (indirect variables)
queries.description: Demonstrates the usage of templated queries, here with indirectly loaded variable values.

queries.name: A templated query about musicians (two variables)
queries.description: Demonstrates the usage of templated queries, here with two variables.

queries.name: Source verification
queries.description: Demonstrates source verification. Query components from three kinds of sources: a non-verifiable source, a successfully verifiable source, and a verifiable source with an incorrect proof.

queries.name: Sources from an index file
queries.description: Query components (including details about materials) with the sources obtained from index files.

queries.name: Components
queries.description: Query components.

queries.name: Components (select one)
queries.description: Query one component; select it by name.

queries.name: Components and their materials
queries.description: Query components (including details about materials).

queries.name: Component (select one) and percentage of a material (select one)
queries.description: Select a component by its name and a material by its name to see by what percentage the material is used in that component (empty result of not used).

queries.name: Is there an artist influenced by Picasso (forced negative answer)?
queries.description: Demonstrates an ASK query, here with negative answer, forced by using an irrelevant data source.

askQuery.trueText: Yes, there is at least one artist influenced by Picasso!
askQuery.falseText: No, there is not a single artist influenced by Picasso (if you look at the wrong data).

queries.name: Average value - queryLocation without rq
queries.description: Should demonstrates a query calculating some average, but the queryLocation is faultive.

queries.name: Average value - unexisting queryLocation (ends in .rq)
queries.description: Should demonstrates a query calculating some average, but the queryLocation is faultive.

queries.name: Sources from an index file (requiring authentication)
queries.description: Query components (including details about materials) with the sources obtained from index files that require authentication to retrieve said sources.

queries.name: A query on a secret and a public list of books
queries.description: Demonstrates a query on a source requiring authentication and a source not requiring authentication.

queries.name: A templated query about musicians, two variables (indirect variables)
queries.description: Demonstrates the usage of templated queries, here with indirectly loaded variable values and with two variables.

queries.name: A templated query about musicians (double results)
queries.description: This query tests whether a template variable is expanded more than once. If it works, this query will return all results twice.

queries.name: Components and their materials, with sources from index file also containing an unauthorized source
queries.description: Query components (including details about materials) with the sources obtained from index files, including an unauthorized source of favourite books, to check lenient.

queries.name: Components and their materials, with mixed sources from comunicaContext and index file
queries.description: Query components (including details about materials) with sources obtained from both comunicaContext.sources and index files.

queries.name: Component and materials - 1 variable (indirect source & indirect variables)
queries.description: Query components (including details about materials) with the sources obtained from index files and variables from the sources.

queries.name: Component and materials - 1 variable (indirect source & indirect variables; one unauthorized source)
queries.description: Query components (including details about materials) with the sources obtained from index files and variables from the sources. One unauthorized indirect source, to check lenient while getting variable options.

queries.name: Component and materials - 1 variable (indirect source & indirect variables; no indirect sources found)
queries.description: Query components (including details about materials) with zero sources obtained from index files and variables from the sources.

queries.name: Component and materials - 2 variables (indirect source & indirect variables)
queries.description: Query components (including details about materials) with the sources obtained from index files and variables from the sources.

queries.name: A test on DISTINCT LIMIT OFFSET
queries.description: Query two sources containing duplicated triples. The query uses DISTINCT, LIMIT and OFFSET.

queries.name: A test on counting the total number results
queries.description: Query a source containing ?s ?p1 ?o and ?s ?p2 ?o with p1 != p2 and request only ?s ?o.

queries.name: Triples with object, objects of different types
queries.description: Gives at most 50 triples with a given object in the indicated datasources.

queries.name: Http proxy test combined with indirect sources and source verification
queries.description: Contents same as those for the 'Source verification' query, but now through http proxy in a worse case test.

queries.name: Sources from an index file - no sources
queries.description: Test what happens if the sourceIndex query results in 0 sources.

queries.name: A templated query about musicians (indirect variables) - no sources
queries.description: Test what happens when variables cannot be loaded because no source(s) available.

queries.name: A query that looks for names that are the object of predicate schema:name
queries.description: Tests a single link in the 'name' column header.

queries.name: A query that looks for names that are both the objects of predicates schema:name and rdfs:label
queries.description: Tests two links in the 'name' column header.

queries.name: Reserved variable name test
queries.description: Tests a query with a reserved variable name.
